sen.j: 沢村 貞子（さわむら さだこ、1908年（明治41年）11月11日 - 1996年（平成8年）8月16日）は俳優、随筆家。
sen.e: Sadako SAWAMURA (November 11, 1908 - August 16, 1996) was the actress and essayist.
Sadako SAWAMURA (November 11, 1908 - August 16, 1996) was an actress and essayist.
Sadako SAWAMURA (November 11, 1908 - August 16, 1996) was an actress and essayist.

sen.j: 東京市浅草区生まれ。
sen.e: She was born in Asakusa Ward, Tokyo City.
She was born in Asakusa Ward, Tokyo City.
She was born in Asakusa Ward, Tokyo City.

sen.j: 本名、大橋貞子（おおはし ていこ）。
sen.e: Her real name was Teiko OHASHI.
Her real name was Teiko OHASHI.
Her real name was Teiko OHASHI.

sen.j: 来歴・人物
sen.e: Biography and Personal Profile
Biography and Personal Profile
Biography and personal profile

sen.j: 狂言作者・竹芝伝蔵（本名、加藤伝太郎）の次女として生まれた。
sen.e: She was born as the second daughter of Denzo TAKESHIBA (his real name: Dentaro KATO), the Kabuki playwright.
Sadako SAWAMURA was born as the second daughter of Denzo TAKESHIBA (his real name was Dentaro KATO), the Kabuki playwright.
Sadako SAWAMURA was born as the second daughter of Denzo TAKESHIBA (his real name was Dentaro KATO), the Kabuki playwright.

sen.j: 兄は沢村国太郎、弟は加東大介。
sen.e: His older brother is Kunitaro SAWAMURA and younger brother is Daisuke KATO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His older brother was Kunitaro SAWAMURA and younger brother was Daisuke KATO.
His older brother was Kunitaro SAWAMURA and younger brother was Daisuke KATO.

sen.j: 沢村国太郎の息子で貞子の甥は長門裕之・津川雅彦で、ともに俳優である。
sen.e: The son of Kunitaro SAWAMURA, Sadako's nephews are Hiroyuki NAGATO and Masahiko TSUGAWA, and both are actors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kunitaro SAWAMURA's sons ()Sadako's nephews) are Hiroyuki NAGATO and Masahiko TSUGAWA, both of whom are actors.
Kunitaro SAWAMURA's sons (Sadako's nephews) are Hiroyuki NAGATO and Masahiko TSUGAWA, both of whom are actors.

sen.j: また俳優の藤原釜足は元夫である。
sen.e: The actor, Kamatari FUJIWARA was her former husband.
The actor, Kamatari FUJIWARA was her former husband.
The actor, Kamatari FUJIWARA was her former husband.

sen.j: 府立第一高等女学校（現東京都立白鴎高等学校）卒業後、日本女子大学師範家政学部を中退、在学中に新築地劇団に入る。
sen.e: After graduating from Kyoto Prefectural First Girls' High School (present Tokyo Metropolitan Hakuo Senior High School), she was dropped out of Faculty of Normal and Home Economics, Japan Women's University and entered New Tsukiji Theater Company while in school.

After graduating from Kyoto Prefectural First Girls' High School (present Tokyo Metropolitan Hakuo Senior High School), she was dropped out of the Japan Women's University Normal Department of Home Economics and entered the New Tsukiji Theater Company while attending school.

After graduating from Kyoto Prefectural First Girls' High School (present Tokyo Metropolitan Hakuo Senior High School), she was dropped out of the Japan Women's University Normal Department of Home Economics and entered the New Tsukiji Theater Company while attending school.

sen.j: この頃治安維持法違反で逮捕され獄中生活を送る。
sen.e: Around this time, she was arrested in violation of Maintenance of Public Order Law and spent her time in prison.
It was during this time that she was arrested in violation of the Peace Preservation Law and was sent to prison.
It was during this time that she was arrested in violation of the Peace Preservation Law and was sent to prison.

sen.j: その後、日活太秦現代劇部に入社。
sen.e: She entered Nikkatsu Uzumasa, contemporary drama department after that.
She later went on to enter Nikkatsu Uzumasa's contemporary drama department.
She later went on to enter Nikkatsu Uzumasa's contemporary drama department.

sen.j: 小津安二郎監督作品などで名脇役として活躍し、生涯で100本を越す映画に出演した。
sen.e: She had success as the well-known supporting actress in the films directed by Yasujiro OZU and was casted over 100 films throughout her life.
She was successful as a well-known supporting actress in films directed by Yasujiro OZU and was cast in over 100 films throughout her life.
She was successful as a well-known supporting actress in films directed by Yasujiro OZU and was cast in over 100 films throughout her life.

sen.j: 1956年、映画「赤線地帯」（溝口健二監督）で毎日映画コンクール女優助演賞を受賞。
sen.e: She received the award for the best supporting actress of Mainichi Film Awards by the film called 'Akasen chitai' (Street of Shame)(directed by Kenji MIZOGUCHI) in 1956.
In 1956, she received the award for the best supporting actress at the Mainichi Film Awards for a film entitled 'Akasen Chitai' (Street of Shame) (directed by Kenji MIZOGUCHI).
In 1956, she received the award for the best supporting actress at the Mainichi Film Awards for a film entitled 'Akasen Chitai' (Street of Shame) (directed by Kenji MIZOGUCHI).

sen.j: 1996年には日本アカデミー賞会長特別賞を受賞。
sen.e: She received the Chairman's Special Award of Japan Academy Awards in 1996.
She received the Special Award from the Chairman at the Japan Academy Awards in 1996.
She received the Special Award from the Chairman at the Japan Academy Awards in 1996.

sen.j: エッセイストとしても数多くの著作を世に出している。
sen.e: She published many books as the essayist.
She published many works as the essayist.
She published many works as the essayist.

sen.j: 特に1977年に発表した自伝的随筆『私の浅草』は下町の風情を生き生きと綴りあげた名著と評価が高い。
sen.e: Especially, her autobiographical essay "My Asakusa" introduced in 1977 was highly valued as the great book that lively wrote about downtown taste.
In particular, her autobiographical essay "My Asakusa" published in 1977 was highly praised as a masterpiece that vividly portrays the flavor of downtown Tokyo.
In particular, her autobiographical essay "My Asakusa" published in 1977 was highly praised as a masterpiece that vividly portrays the flavor of downtown Tokyo.

sen.j: この作品は第25回日本エッセイスト・クラブ賞を受賞し、『貝のうた』とともに連続テレビ小説『おていちゃん』の原作となった。
sen.e: This work won the 25th Japan Essayist Club Award and became the original piece for "Otei-chan"of the morning drama series, as well as "Shell Song."
This work won the 25th Japan Essayist Club Award, and the basis of both the book "Kai no Uta" and the morning drama series "Otei-chan."
This work won the 25th Japan Essayist Club Award, and the basis of both the book "Kai no Uta" and the morning drama series "Otei-chan."

sen.j: 立ち上がるとき「どっこいしょ」といったことに衰えを感じ女優を引退。
sen.e: She retired as the actress because she brought out 'dokkoisho' (a word brought out when you put some muscle or move your tired body) when she raised herself up.
She retired an actress because of weakness felt when standing up.
She retired an actress because of weakness felt when standing up.

sen.j: 横須賀市に隠居。
sen.e: She was retired in Yokosuka City.
She retired in Yokosuka City.
She retired in Yokosuka City.

sen.j: 毎日湘南の海を望遠鏡で眺めて過ごした。
sen.e: She spent her life watching the sea of Shonan with a telescope everyday.
Every day, she would watch the sea of Shonan with a telescope.
Every day, she would watch the sea of Shonan with a telescope.

sen.j: 1996年8月16日、心不全のため死去。
sen.e: She died due to heart failure on August 16, 1996.
She died due to heart failure on August 16, 1996.
She died due to heart failure on August 16, 1996.

sen.j: 享年87。
sen.e: She was 87 years old.
She was 87 years old.
She died at the age of 87.

sen.j: 本人の遺志により、葬儀では身内だけで納棺式を行い荼毘にふした。
sen.e: According to her will, the coffin rite and cremation were done only with her relative at the funeral.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In accordance with her will, the placing of body in the coffin and cremation were conducted with only her family present.
In accordance with her will, the placing of body in the coffin and cremation were conducted with only her family present.

sen.j: その後、遺骨は先立った夫・大橋恭彦の遺骨とともに相模湾に散骨された。
sen.e: After that, her ashes were scattered with the ashes of her husband Yasuhiko OHASHI, who died before her, in Sagami bay.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Her ashes were later scattered with the ashes of her husband Yasuhiko OHASHI, who died before her, in Sagami bay.
Her ashes were later scattered with the ashes of her husband Yasuhiko OHASHI, who died before her, in Sagami bay.
